title: Figma Buzz Unveils Three Key Features to Accelerate Brand Asset Creation and Consistency

paragraphs.content: Figma has introduced three new features for Figma Buzz: configurable templates built on design systems, plugins for app integration and animation, and in-app video trimming. These updates enable designers and marketers to create high-impact, on-brand assets like social media graphics and event materials at scale. Launched in open beta at Config 2025, Buzz acts as a brand-safe content factory, allowing teams to copy-paste Figma designs and customize them without breaking guidelines.

paragraphs.content: The features address user feedback for deeper customization, with templates using component properties to let marketers switch options easily. Plugins connect to digital asset management, translation systems, and motion tools, while video trimming eliminates external editing needs. Industry views position Buzz as a Canva rival integrated with Figma's ecosystem, empowering non-designers through Content seats.

sections.title: Configurable Templates and Plugins Enhance Design System Integration

paragraphs.content: Configurable templates allow brand designers to publish Figma components into Buzz, where marketers browse and swap variations without managing hundreds of files. Plugins bring in tools for digital asset management, translation, and animation, with teams able to create internal plugins via the Figma Community. These additions build on Buzz's grid view and bulk creation for streamlined workflows.

Figma's 2025 release notes highlight over 150 features, including Buzz enhancements like refreshed inserts and OpenAI-powered image generation. Schema 2025 updates improve instance speeds, indirectly supporting template performance in Buzz.
